stages.text: Thank you for finding me! I’m Elara. I thought I was done for stuck outside all alone. But now I have you! Say... you don't think you'd be up for helping me again would you? Kobolds stole my pendant, and I’m too scared to go after them alone. Will you please help?

replies.text: Of course. I'd be more than honored to go after your lost treasure.
replies.response: Really?! Elara's ears twitch and her tail wags. Thank you so much! I'll be here waiting for you hero.

replies.text: I can’t help you right now.
replies.response: Oh… I’ll wait here then, hoping someone else comes by.

flavor.response: It was my mothers. Normally it gets passed down to the oldest daughter. However they had already taken her away. My mom gave it to me before she was also taken away...

flavor.text: They were taken away? Who had taken them?
flavor.response: Slave catchers. They raided our small camp. There was about 50 of us total. We ran as hard as we could but and ice storm hit us. That's when they got my sister...

flavor.text: What about your parents? What happened to them?
flavor.response: I'd really rather not talk about that...Please if you could get my pendant back it would mean the world to me.

stages.text: You truly are an amazing hero. No matter what you better come back.
You didn’t want to help… I hope I can find someone else, but I’ll stay here for now.
How’s it going with my pendant? Those Kobolds are tricky, aren’t they?
You got it back! Thank you so much! Elara ties the pendant to her tail. I can’t believe you helped a beast folk like me.

replies.text: Of course. It was easy work for me.
replies.response: You’re amazing! Elara jumps in joy smiling at you warmly.

replies.text: That’s all I’m doing for you.
replies.response: Oh… I hoped we’d continue, but thank you anyway.

replies.text: It was dangerous. I could've died.
replies.response: But you kept your promise and came back.

stages.text: Hello hero! Elara yells as you walk past her in the tavern. Thank you again for everything you've done. You and Elara spend some time together drinking. She speaks to you with a lower guard. You know... I'd do anything to see my parents again. She jokingly knudges you. What would you say to another adventure? We can try to track them down.

replies.text: Once the morning light hits we will look for them.
replies.response: Elara sits somber at the thought of seeing her parents again. Hero, whatever you find out there please bring it back to me.

replies.text: Go out into the cold to look for the dead? No thanks.

flavor.response: There was a Frosted Den we passed. We were being chased and they told me to keep running.
...I can only hope they are out there..

flavor.text: You slam down the final drink for the night. Elara! She is stunned by your outbrust loud enough for the entire Tavern to hear. I promise I will find them at any cost.
flavor.response: Elara looks as if she is about to cry. Most humans never even look Beast Folk in the the eyes. Never mind a human risking their own skin on such a foolish adventure. Hero...She clinges onto you with tears. Thank you.

stages.text: It's okay...I am asking a lot...
Hero? Have you been to the Frosted Den?
Hero...You're all scratched up and hurt. Did you run into any monsters? Please tell me everything. Elara proceeds to to try cleaning you off and applying bandages.

replies.text: I made it here safely. Surely we can follow up our next lead.
replies.response: Hero...Elara looks up at you with hope in her eyes. A new fight is coming.

replies.text: That’s all I’m doing for you.
replies.response: Oh… I hoped we’d continue, but thank you anyway.

flavor.text: Elara...I found wolves. The Frosted Den had a family of strong wolves that seem to have eaten everything made of meat within miles.
flavor.response: Oh hero. Elara blushes her face red at her Hero facing such a threat. Hero you have to promise me whenever you leave the safety of the city gates you will always return.

flavor.text: Of course Elara. I wouldn't dream of leaving you alone.
flavor.response: Oh Hero. Elara with a small smile clinges on her Hero. You faced great danger just for my peace of mind. Now we have a lead. But... given your current state. I couldn't ask anymore of you.

flavor.text: You ponder for a moment. You can see the weight on her heart the pain of not knowning the fate of her loved ones. Is it time to move on? Or could you see this out till the end? You meet her gaze. For now I rest, and we drink to a completed hunt.
flavor.response: Elara can see your attempt to make her smile. Rounds of ale for all. The

talk.text: How do you like the tavern?
talk.response: It’s warm and cozy—much better than that campsite!
flavor_text: Elara’s tail flicks as she looks around.
She seems more at ease here.

talk.response: Every day… but being here with you helps.
Full of laughter and stories—before the slavers came.
flavor_text: Her eyes light up with memory.

talk.text: What do you think of the food here?
talk.response: It’s tasty! I’ve never had bread this soft.
flavor_text: She nibbles on a piece of bread.

talk.response: Oh, just some drunks last night—nothing exciting.
flavor_text: Her ears perk up at a distant shout.

talk.response: One about a fox who tricked a wolf—want to hear it?
flavor_text: Her voice takes on a playful tone.

talk.response: It’s safe now, thanks to you. I check it every day.
flavor_text: She pats the pendant on her tail.
A small smile crosses her face.

talk.response: It’s pretty, but so cold! My fur barely keeps up.

talk.text: What do you do for fun?
talk.response: I weave little trinkets—want me to make you one?
In clans, usually—mine was small but tight-knit.
To find a home again… maybe with friends like you.

room.text: You’ve been so kind, and we’ve been through so much. Can I stay with you here?

replies.response: Thank you! A room together sounds cozy.

replies.text: Not yet, let’s keep things as they are.

invitation.text: You have a room here, and we’ve grown close. Would you mind if I stayed with you?

replies.text: I’d love for you to stay with me.
replies.response: Really? That makes me so happy—I feel at home with you.

replies.text: I’m not ready for that yet.
replies.response: Oh… I understand. Maybe another time?

romance.response: Oh! Thank you… you make me blush.

flavor_text: She hesitates, then takes your hand.
Her grip is warm and gentle.

romance.text: What do you think of us?
romance.response: I feel safe with you… maybe more than safe.
flavor_text: A nervous smile plays on her lips.

romance.text: Want to share a quiet evening?
